citations.narrative:
At the time of inspection, the records of acquisition and disposition were incomplete. The record of animals on hand did
not include 4 pigeons, 1 longhorn cow, and 1 goat. The disposition records were missing for 2 quail and 1 bison. The
acquisition records for most of the farm animals were incomplete or unable to be located.
Complete and accurate records of inventory, acquisition, and disposition are necessary to track animals used in regulated
activities to ensure their humane care, use, acquisition, and disposition. The licensee shall make, keep, and maintain
records or forms which fully and correctly disclose information concerning each animal purchased or otherwise acquired,
owned, held, or otherwise in his or her possession or under his or her control, or which is transported, euthanized, sold, or
otherwise disposed of by that licensee.
To be corrected by February 8, 2024.

The facility has an enclosure that allows for public contact through a fence but does not have a readily identifiable
attendant present. This enclosure contains 5 goats, 8 pigs, 1 sheep, 2 zebu, 3 ducks, 1 goose, and 2 turkeys. The
inspector witnessed members of the public feeding and petting animals in this enclosure without any supervision from the
facility.
Without an attendant present to monitor interactions, both animals and members of the public are at greater risk of injury.
The facility must have a responsible, knowledgeable, and readily identifiable employee or attendant present at all times
during periods of public contact.

There is an enclosure that contains a pool for one capybara. The walls of the pool have areas of flaking paint which has
resulted in an accumulation of paint flakes in the grass around the pool.
Flaking paint can be ingested by the animals in the enclosure and cause illness. All housing facilities must be constructed
of such material and of such strength as appropriate for the animals involved. All housing facilities shall be structurally
sound and shall be maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury and to contain the animals.
To be corrected by February 8, 2024.

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
In the enclosure housing 19 pigeons and 10 quail, there is an excessive accumulation of feces on various surfaces,
including the ramp and door for the shelter, the hanging baskets, and the PVC pipe along the floor.
An accumulation of feces can cause soiling of the animals and increase the risk of disease, pests, and odors. The facility
must remove excreta and food wase from the primary enclosure as often as necessary to prevent excessive accumulation
of feces and food waste, to prevent soiling of the birds contained in the primary enclosures, and to reduce disease
hazards, insects, pests, and odors.
To be corrected by January 29, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
